name: Captain Lord Mansion

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I were celebrating our 30th wedding anniversary and The Captain Lord Mansion made it a perfect experience. Our room was gorgeous with every ammenity you could ask for, including a heated marble floor in the bathroom. The staff felt like family, the food was delicious, and the location was terrific - with the town just a five minute walk away. We loved it!!!!
reviews.title: I have a new favorite B & B!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Having just returned from a tour of New England I can say without a doubt that the most memorable stay was here. There is not one thing I could critisise as everything was taken care of and we were looked after with great attention to detail. The breakfasts were the best we have ever had and nothing was to much of a problem if you did not want what was on offer. The afternoon teas just deliteful. It is no wonder one couple will have completed 86 visits by the end of this year. We hope to see you again soon.
reviews.title: WOW

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Bev was so helpful when I made the reservation. Her descriptions of the rooms were on the mark. Our room was lovely, spacious with a fireplace, comfortable bed, and wonderful bathroom. When we checked in there was a list of everyone staying there, how many times they had stayed at the Captain Lord Mansion, and where they were from. We were given a tour and asked whether we wanted the early or late breakfast seating. We had dinner reservations and they had printed directions ready for us. Everyone raved about the afternoon tea, don't miss the iced coffee. Breakfast was delicious. This is an inn that pays attention to details and makes me want to return. As a side note, on the night we were there I noted vacancy signs on all of the other inns but the Captain Lord Mansion was full.
reviews.title: attention to details

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at Captain Lord Mansion for two nights in Sept and had an excellent experience. The room was very nicely decorated and very cozy. It was a nice size as was the bathroom. The staff was very helpful and the breakfast was delicious. I would highly recommend Captain Lord Mansion.
reviews.title: Wonderful stay at Captain Lord Mansion

reviews.text: This was our first experience at a Bed and Breakfast. We were in awe at every turn as the hostess gave us a tour of the Mansion. The details that went into every room truly made us feel that we were sent back in time. Our visit at the Inn was very relaxing and special. I can not imagine a better way to visit a small town in Maine. We loved every moment from the wonderful breakfast, to the bicycle rides through town, shopping in the village of Kennebunkport, then returning to our beautiful room at Captain Lord Mansion. We can hardly wait to return for our next visit.
reviews.title: New England Charm

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Captian Lord Mansion is the best bed and breakfast I have ever stayed in. Select Registry got it right. Everything from friendliness, service, cleanliness and comfort were top of the line. All the little luxuries were a treat. They think of everything. I highly recommend and will definately return many times.
reviews.title: The best ever!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We received a warm welcome upon arrival. The location is great and within walking distance to town. B&B staff was excellent and very helpful. Our room was always cleaned as we enjoyed our delicious breakfast and we were never disturbed. We plan on staying again for the Christmas prelude.
reviews.title: We plan on staying again!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We chose the Captain Lord for our visit to Maine at the end of August because of all the previous reviews and we were not disappointed. The owners were actually out of the country during our visit, but you would have never known it from the 5 star service the staff delivered.
reviews.title: A Beautiful B&B with 5 Star Hotel Touches

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The fantastic breakfast's were served at two different seatings....so you could eat early on some mornings and late on others. We never had to eat lunch even when we ate early. And there was 24 hour fresh delicious coffe available. They were willing and very able to accommodate any food allergies or dietary restrictions....all you have to do is tell them.
reviews.title: Wonderful stay, beautiful Inn, great hosts, fabulous room, tasty breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent five nights in the Regulator, a corner room on the third floor. It was absolutely lovely....huge room, fireplace, comfy sofa and chairs, plenty of room for luggage and a bed you hated to get out of. There was a small flat screen TV and the WiFi was fast and dependable. We liked the shower head so much that we ordered one for our own bathroom at home. There were so many little special touches that I had never seen even in very high end hotels. If you don't have what you need in the room, all you have to do is ask. This, of course, was an old mansion that was restored and made into a B&B by the owners....but they did an incredible job....not only did the floor above you or below you not creak, but you could never hear anyone in the adjacent rooms and the Inn was quite full while we were there....very impressive for a B&B.
reviews.title: A perfectly splendid experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We greeted when we first arrived like we had stayed there for years, this was our first time. The inkeepers are very friendly and could answer any our questions. The staff was great, we were shoed around the Inn and taken to our room. It was on the third floor. A cornor romm with lots of windows and light. The room are set up for luxury and comfort. We had a gas fireplace. it was wonderful. The breakfast each morning was to die for.
reviews.title: Wonderful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have stayed at the Captain Lord Mansion three times and are scheduled to stay there again in November. We love it! The Inn is beautiful, the hosts are gracious and friendly, the staff is delightful and the food is delicious. We have stayed in three different rooms and they were all beautifully decorated and spotless. They use the same sheets that we have at home and they are so comfortable. (and not cheap)
reviews.title: First Rate Inn-One of my most favorite places to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There is always a Welcome Back note and treat in our room along with soft drinks, water and juice. The staff is very accommodating with anything you might need. They have great recommendations for local restaurants. And speaking of food, the breakfasts are delicious and fun. Yes, you are seated with other guests, but we have always enjoyed talking to everyone at our table. My husband is not a morning person, but even he enjoys talking with guests from all over the country.
reviews.title: If you enjoy your privacy, this isn't the inn for you.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have traveled extensively and we are VERY particular about where we stay. And we love the Captain Lord Mansion.
reviews.title: Captain Lords Mansion - Our First B&B! WOW!!!
Best B&B we've ever been to - ever!!!!!!!!!
reviews.text: I was looking forward to staying at the Captain Lord Mansion for years, and I was finally able to secure a summer weekend stay for my husband and I. My disappointment began on our arrival.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Captain Lord Mansion the third weekend in October for our anniversary. We had a lovely card and iced champagne with chocolates waiting for us in our room the moment we arrived! We were in the "Harvest" room, a 3rd floor corner suite. It was lovely, full of antiques and clever touches. For instance, candy dishes with candy inside, a very unique mending kit, etc. The room was a delight to explore, and very clean. We were graciously welcomed from the start and felt well taken care of. This B&B has a variety of amenities for the asking (bikes, umbrellas, etc). Breakfasts were delicious, with a variety of items offered. Loved the time of year, as the town was slowly winding down from the busy summer, yet still warm enough to enjoy walks or biking around town. Will definitely be back!
reviews.title: Magnificent!

reviews.text: During our recent trip to Maine we stayed at the CLM for two days and the beginning of our trip and three days at the end. We had stayed here before and couldn't wait to come back. We prefer staying in the Garden House and have stayed in three of the rooms. The Lois is still my favorite and that will be my room choice on our next trip! Rick and Bev's objective to make all of their guests feel special has been achieved. By the way, if Holly is preparing and serving your breakfast - she is the absolute best.
reviews.title: Hoping we can come often enough that we will get a brick in the garden.
My favorite place to go.
reviews.text: This was my 6th visit to the CLM & again everything was wonderful. The quality of this Inn is seen from the moment you walk in the door. The staff is so helpful & friendly. If you don't know what to do while in Maine the staff will be more than glad to help you. The sheets on the beds are fabulous, the soaps, shampoos, & robes are heavenly, & the breakfasts are warm & friendly. I will continue to come here as long as I am able. Thank you all so much for another wonderful stay, I will see you again soon.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I discovered this bed and breakfast by chance and booked it immediately when we looked through their website and were drawn into the detail and elegance of the rooms. When we arrived at the Captain Lord Mansion we were speechless. It is truely beyond words. The staff was extremely helpful and caring. The sheets were so comfortable we ended up buying a set. I did not want to leave the bed--it truely was a dream trip. This is a must if you want to experience a bed and breakfast in Maine. KP & SP Grand Forks, ND
reviews.title: Beyond words!!!
Everything it says it is and more!!
reviews.text: My husband and I renewed our wedding vows after 41 years. We chose Captain Lord's Mansion for our mini-second honeymoon. I cannot tell you how much we loved our stay there!! Our room was beautiful. The decor was stunning. The lighting was soft and flattering. The gas fireplace was easy to use and added just the right warmth. The heated bathroom floors were a wonderful treat. Breakfast each morning was filling and delicious. The staff were very attentive and friendly as were the guests.I cannot wait to go back!!

description: Escape to the only AAA 4 Diamond bed and breakfast in Kennebunkport, ME. Enjoy spacious guest rooms at our Kennebunkport inn with comfy beds, heated floors, luxurious amenities, fireplaces, & Jacuzzi tubs. Our B&B in Kennebunkport also features complimentary gourmet breakfast, beach chairs & towels, Wi-Fi, in-room snacks, & afternoon beverages. Steps from wonderful shops, galleries, and restaurants, our Kennebunkport bed & breakfast is the perfect romantic Maine getaway. 2010 Fodor’s Choice!
